answers.text: the end of the eighteenth century

qas.question: Who wrote A History of British Birds?
What year was Thomas Bewick's book published?

answers.text: between the islands of Minorca and Majorca

qas.question: Which directions were the Swallows flying?

context: It was not until <a0_0>the end of the eighteenth century<a0_0/> that migration as an explanation for the winter disappearance of birds from northern climes was accepted. <a1_0>Thomas Bewick<a1_0/>'s A History of British Birds (Volume 1, <a2_0>1797<a2_0/>) mentions a report from "a very intelligent master of a vessel" who, "<a3_0>between the islands of Minorca and Majorca<a3_0/>, saw great numbers of Swallows flying <a4_0>northward<a4_0/>", and states the situation in Britain as follows:
